bestBHT.bht: Only someone with thoughts alien from Jesus could have murmured about the costly devotion Mary showed, contrasting her love with the forthcoming betrayal of Judas. The rebuke of the Lord may have stimulated his long-hidden traitorous scheme. Judas, who would betray Jesus, grudgingly criticized Mary's extravagant display of faith, showcasing the shameful fact that clung to his name. Mary's devotion inadvertently contributed to the honor of the dead, while Judas, driven by selfishness, unknowingly played a role in Jesus' eventual death.

This is the shameful fact that clung to the name of Judas."

bhtAttempts.bht: Only someone with thoughts alien from Jesus would have murmured about the costly devotion Mary showed towards Him. This contrast between Mary's love and the betrayal to come from Judas, whose traitorous scheme was stimulated by the rebuke of the Lord, is significant. Judas, who would ultimately betray Jesus, grudgingly criticized Mary's extravagant display of faith and love. The name Iscariot clung to both Judas and his father, revealing the shameful fact of his betrayal. Mary, in her devotion, honored the dead, unwittingly paving the way for the death itself that Judas, in his selfishness, would bring about.
